Posts.Content: Hello ... what I can say right now is wait for your PSA test. I have PC and I am 41 years old. Just dit the surgery 15 days ago. I had blood in my urine as well but nothing on rectal exam. Maybe you have just inflammation on your prostate ... again, wait for your PSA level and come back here to talk about it, ok ? Take care
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: Prostate question

Posts.Content: Hello everybody Maybe some people did read my case few weeks ago but here are the data: I am 41 years old. PC detected in October 2012 Gleason 7: < = 5% After 2 opinions just to be sure, I decided to have the prostate remove I am going to have a radical perineal prostatectomy (RPP) at the CTCA (Cancer treatment center of America) at Philly the 8th January. Doctor Sloane will do the surgery. The CTCA is wonderful and I recommend it to everybody. Hes going to try to do the nerves sparing but not sure at 100% that will be possible (depend if the cancer will be in this area or not). I am very very very nervous right now. Still can not believe that does happen to me at 41 years old. But will take the best of what will happen from now. I will keep you posted guys .... good luck to everybody
Posts.Title: D-3 before the surgery

Posts.Content: thank you for reply ... I am very new to this so maybe my question will be stupid, so sorry about that. You said that you had a surgery, so that mean that they took out your prostate, right ? And you said that your PSA did come back .. that's mean the cancer was somewhere else ? I am confuse about that My PSA was at 2.86 ... the meds was doing nothing so they decided to do a biopsy and here we are Again I am very lost right now .. I really dont know what to do .... how long time I have before to take a decision, what decision to take ... I am so glad to have this forum ... thanks again
Posts.Title: biopsy result yesterday ... I have prostate cancer at 40 years old. Need advices

Posts.Content: on 13 samples. 3 were positive. 2 : gleason 6 and one: 3+4 all of them < or equal 5% so looks like its the very beginning. My PSA is at 2.8 and pretty stable since august 2012. The 2 different hospital said I can not do a watching treatment because the gleason 7 .... the slides got tests 2 times to confirm the 7 so yeah, nervous ... not super worried about the cancer by itself (Everybody said its just the very beginning) but about continence and ED ... well we will see. I do trust the surgeon, hes very nice and I know he will do his best for the cancer and the side effects .... ok need to spend some time with my wife now ...
Posts.Title: D-3 before the surgery

Posts.Content: ok its been 9 days since the surgery .... The surgeon said that everything did go well. He was able to save the nerves both sides. YEahhhhhhhhh The recovery is pretty hard specially because the surgery was a RPP. But that was my choice. I was very comfortable with the surgeon and preferred to have a hard time of recovery with good outcome than fast recovery with doubts of outcome. The hardest time is to sit down ... That 's going to take a while to feel better but I just need to be patience ... if u guys have some tips about recovery from RPP .... I am going to the hospital tomorrow to take out my catheter ... finally !!! this thing is annoying and painful sometime too. The surgeon told me that I should have the result of my prostate in about 2 weeks (surprise bc usually that take just 1 week). So, so far so good .... It's strange to say that but yes, I am living without prostate now and hopefully I will be able to say in few days, living without PC !
Posts.Title: D-3 before the surgery

Posts.Content: Hello everybody. First sorry if I do English mistakes ... still need to improve that. I am 40 years old and after a high level PSA, I did a biopsy last week and yesterday I got the result. I do have prostate cancer I will have an appointment with a specialist in 10 days on the 13 samples, 3 are bad .... here the numbers, if somebody can explain me ... I dont understand : Core(cm) Gleason %PCA 1.5 3+3 5% 1.0 3+3 <5% 1.1 3+4 5% so the doctor told me that I will have to choose my options: - remove with a robot the prostate - freeze the prostate - radiation I really dont know right now and I am lost. I know removing prostate will have side effects (going to the bathroom and sex). Are my result are bad ? If i choose radiation, can I avoid the side effects that I said before ? Is it smart to do that ? Please guys, I need some advices .... I am so young for that

Posts.Title: biopsy result yesterday ... I have prostate cancer at 40 years old. Need advices

Posts.Content: so its been now 15 days after the rpp surgery. I did remove the catheter today. Did not go to the restroom yet ... what can I expect ? Will be a last minute urge ? or will be like before, just will need to go in few minutes ? Is it going to burn or any pain for a while ? I forget to ask the doctor about that. So I should have the prostate result in 1 week from now (dont know why, this process take 3 weeks ... most of u guys, did take only 1 week). I going to order the pump ... I am on cialis since 3 days (5mg everyday). Going back to the doctor in 2 months for a PSA test and (if my penis did not move yet) begin to do injection. Any suggestions guys ???
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: 15 days after the surgery

Posts.Content: The nurse did remove the catheter. Very painful but freeee after that !!! Ok, so, since yesterday I do not have leak at all ! thats the good news .. the bad one: I had to go to the bathroom every 2 hours last night !!! So very very tired this morning and that will be a lonnnng day at work. I am since 4 days on 5mg Cialis ... right now, nothing ... should I begin to exercise him right now or do I need to wait a little bit ? The hospital recommended me a pump from a manufacturer. It's about $300 and my assurance doesn't cover it. I did check on ebay and can found a lot of them for about $50. Are they ok to buy ? Looks like to me they are doing exactly the same job ... right ? Thanks Vincent
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: 15 days after the surgery

Posts.Content: yeah finally after like 10 calls I got approved from my assurance (thanks to my wife who did take care of that, I can not really with my broken English (I am French))... they will cover 100% for the manual one ... To be honest, I am freaking out a little bit because I heard to use the pump as soon as possible and now it'a been 15 days after the surgery and I still dont have it .... I dont want to lose it Am I little stupid to be scare like that ? is it not that emergency ? I did notice that my "winner" is little shorter than before
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: rehabilitation question after 16 day from the surgery

Posts.Content: Hello everybody ... My doctor told me now to begin to use a pump for my rehabilitation .... I do take Cialis 5mg daily also for the recorvery. I really can not spend $600 for the pump so I am trying to found a good quality one but cheaper. Does somebody have some advice about it ? Thanks so much Vincent
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: rehabilitation question after 16 day from the surgery

Posts.Content: yes HighlanderCFH, Just 1 week after the surgery, my doctor asked me to take Cialis 5mg every day so that what I do right now. I got a one month sample free from him. I am going to fill up the paper from Cialis.com for another month free sample. The doctor said that if nothing move in this area in 2 months, we will try injection just to make all this stuff moving. So I am at 3 days without catheter and so far so good ... no leak at all,i am pretty happy about it.
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: rehabilitation question after 16 day from the surgery

Posts.Content: hello mickcee ... I understand totally your frustration. I am now almost at 4 weeks after the surgery. I am doing better day after day. My "winner" did not move at all since (maybe a little bit 2 night ago (about 1/4 of erection and he did wake me up !!! ). Anyway, because I think I have a big libido and I was very active with my wife before the surgery, I did push myself (alone) 2 times last week. And I do agree with HighlanderCFH, you can have an orgasm without erection ... and its exactly the same sensation !!!! Of course I am trying to go slow on that (still only 4 weeks after the surgery) but after talking to my wife about it, we do agree that during the full recovery time, we will found a way to have a "quality" time together and doing our best with it .... My surgeon told me too that we going to start Trimix in 2 month also if nothing happen down there.
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: coping with celibacy

Posts.Content: I had a RPP last week (open surgery between the testicules and the rectum). I did choose this kind of surgery because I think that the surgeon has better feeling (with his fingers) to control the cut. He did save all the nerves and it was very important to me (I am 41 years old). Bad side of the RPP, its painful. 9 days after, I still have a hard time to sit down. Only the time will make the recovery better.
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41

Posts.Title: Got the news a week ago - Please tell me about Da Vinci

Posts.Content: Hello everybody So I am 4 weeks after my surgery. Since 2 weeks I am using Cialis 5mg daily. My Doctor gave me a one month sample for free. My assurance (that I will lose at the end of this month anyway (my wife will be unemployment)) doesn't cover them. Because money situation, I will have a hard time to afford this pills .... I heard about Cialis you can buy online .... Does somebody can help me to found for reasonable price this pills online (PM me if needed) ?? I did fill up already the paper from Cialis.com for another one month supply
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: Cialis cost ....

Posts.Content: Well ... I dont have a good happy attitude today .... its been few days that he did not move at all ..... I know I know, time is my friend on that ... So I need some big good positive though from you guys !!!! Pauly4: My continence has been 100% perfect from day one. Sometime (did happen 2 times since 2 weeks), I do feel I have a leak but when I do check .... nothing. I still put pad during the day in case but since 4 days, I do not put during the night. I still feel a strange sensation when I do urinate ... not a pain but its not like before .... do u have that too ? take care
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: Nerve sparing robotic surgery

Posts.Content: Just take the positive attitude ! My case is very similar to yours. Gleason 7 and cancer was only inside the capsule. Both nerves saved. I had my surgery 4 weeks ago. Just start to work on my winner last week with the vaccum pump and 5mg cialis daily. So far .... not a lot ... maybe a little move last week during the night. But I am positive specially when I did reach orgasm last week. Yeah I can tell you, your sex life is not over .... I am 41 years old and I will not give up lol how old are you ? I did notice too that at the beginning, my penis was smaller ..... about 1 inch smaller or maybe more. I don't know if because the recovery time or what but since I do use the vaccum pump, he is almost back to his original size .... so don't be scare if that does happen to you ... that should come back with time and/or vaccum pump. Take care and like everybody say: welcome to the another side and be positive !
Posts.Signature: 11/4/12 - Biopsy = PSA 2.8 / Gleason 3+4 / 3 out 13 cores positive <= 5% 1/8/13 - RPP age 41
Posts.Title: Nerve sparing robotic surgery
